metadata.title: CVE-2019-19770 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** In the Linux kernel 4.19.83, there is a use-after-free(read) in the debugfs_remove function in fs/debugfs/inode.c (which is usedto remove a file or directory in debugfs that was previously created with acall to another debugfs function such as debugfs_create_file). NOTE: Linuxkernel developers dispute this issue as not being an issue with debugfs,instead this is an issue with misuse of debugfs within blktrace.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19770` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-129-generic - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-129-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-129-lowlatency - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-129-generic - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-129-lowlatency - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1091-aws - 4.15.0-1091.96~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1103-azure - 4.15.0-1103.114~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1091-gcp - 4.15.0-1091.104~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1062-oracle - 4.15.0-1062.68~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1013-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1013.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-16.19').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.96~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1103.114~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.104~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1062.68~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1013.15').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
